statement.p: Find the area of the circle pictured above.
Round your answer using the rules of working with significant figures. Note using the approximation of 3.14 for \displaystyle\pi may result in an incorrect answer.

solution.p: We must use either the area formula in terms of a diameter (area\displaystyle=\pi{\left(\frac{{d}}{{2}}\right)}^{{2}}) or calculate the radius then the area (area\displaystyle=\pi{r}^{{2}}).
To use the radius formula we calculate \displaystyle{r}={\left(\frac{{6.00}}{{2}}\right)} and then use the formula which is step two above.
